alert.note: Alert for Nemaha (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 5:46AM CDT until May 27 at 8:39AM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Omaha/Valley NE has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Nebraska... Little Nemaha River AT Auburn affecting Nemaha County. For the Little Nemaha River...including Auburn...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Little Nemaha River AT Auburn. * WHEN...From early this morning to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, State Highway 136 between the gage and Auburn begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 22.2 feet...or 0.2 feet above flood stage. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the last 24 hours was 22.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.6 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.6 feet on 09/04/1977. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM CDT.
